dhp209:1: One who is dedicated to that which is not worthy of dedication,
dhp209:2: and who is not dedicated to that which is worthy of dedication,
dhp209:3: has dropped the goal and grabbed their preferences -
dhp209:4: yet envies those who are intent upon self-development.
dhp210:1: Don’t get caught up in what you prefer
dhp210:2: or in what you do not prefer.
dhp210:3: Not seeing what you prefer is hard to bear
dhp210:4: and so is seeing what you do not prefer.
dhp211:2: loss of what one prefers is painful.
dhp212:3: one who is free from preference
dhp212:4: has no sorrow and no fear.
dhp213:3: one who is free from affection
dhp213:4: has no sorrow and no fear.
dhp214:3: one who is free from partiality
dhp214:4: has no sorrow and no fear.
dhp215:3: one who is free from sensuality
dhp215:4: has no sorrow and no fear.
dhp216:3: one who is free from craving
dhp216:4: has no sorrow and no fear.
dhp217:1: One who has perfect morality and wisdom,
dhp217:2: who is established in the Dhamma and understands truth,
dhp217:4: this is the kind of person that the populace prefers.
dhp218:4: such a one is said be going upstream.

dhp220:1: In the same way, when one who has made merit
dhp220:2: goes from this world to the next,
dhp220:3: they are received by their merit
dhp220:4: like the arrival of a beloved relative.
